page.title: 06Television programmes.
page.content: If you don't like the programme on one side you can put another side on.There are four channels on our television,B.B.C. one and two,Border and Channel Four. The last two are independent television companies and show advertisments.You need a television license for a television set and the money goes to the B.B.C..B.B.C stands for the British Broadcasting Corporation.The cost is Â£46 for a coloured set and Â£32 for a black and white set. Only one license is needed for all the sets in one house or hotel. Most people I know have more than one television,so that the members of a family can watch what they want.Many people rent television sets and video recorders. The advantage of renting is that when the set goes wrong,the company will come and repair it or replace the set.
